query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Report on CLIMAS Advisory Board terms of reference and composition and engagement into communication and dissemination plan implementation
result.description: D6.6 Report on CLIMAS Advisory Board terms of reference and composition and engagement into communication and dissemination plan implementation (DEEP BLUE, R, PU, M6) will provide the overview of scope, structure, operation, management and expected contribution of the Advisory Board; terms of reference prepared to serve as the basis for the activities of the advisory Board; a list of Advisory Board members and a plan of their engagement into the awareness raising, dissemination, other stakeholders’ engagement and exploitation of the project results as well as their contribution to the impact of the project following the results chain.

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: D6.1 Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan (DEEP BLUE, R, PU, M3) will present the strategy and actions plan with respect to communication, dissemination and exploitation as well as stakeholders’ engagement. The report will also include specific qualitative and quantitative targets to be met by the respective activities of the project and will be integrated with he results chain indicating results and impact.

result.title: Interim report on project quality, data management, ethics, and gender equality plan implementation
result.description: Interim report on project quality, data management, ethics, and gender equality plan implementation (VILNIUS TECH, R, CONFIDENTIAL, M18) will be co-produced in M18. The interim report will review the 18 months progress of the following plans: project management and handbook (D1.1), data management (D1.2), ethics monitoring (D1.3) and gender equality (D1.4) and provide the amendments and changes in all four plans if needed for the project months 19-36.

result.title: Project Handbook, Management and Quality plan
result.description: D1.1 Project Handbook, Management and Quality Plan (VILNIUS TECH, R, PU, M3): is produced in Task T1.1 and contains general operational information: reference to Horizon Europe rules, roles and responsibilities (e.g. description of the main consortium bodies); reporting processes, planning and protocols for communication within and outside the consortium; document templates for internal reports and deliverables; a quality management plan, a risks and issues management plan, GANTT table, the description of a monitoring and evaluation system; processes for the management of change requests as well as conflict resolution; the results chain including results, objectives and impact as well as indicating baselines in the scoping document.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: D4.5 Joint policy recommendations. Cluster of Horizon Europe-funded projects on innovative bio-methane production
result.description: Joint deliverable, in collaboration with projects funded under topic HORIZON-CL5-2021-D3-03-16 (101084297 SEMPRE-BIO, 101084148 HYFUELUP, 101084288 METHAREN), including guidelines and recommendations to policy makers. Updated in M24 and M42. Project SEMPRE-BIO will be in charge of coordinating the first delivery (M12), HYFUELUP the second (M24) and BIOMETHAVERSE the final (M42).

category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/internet/internet of things

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Digital, Industry and Space

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: List of physiochemical, functional characterization facilities
result.description: Catalogue of methods, devices and facilities for physiochemical and functional characterisation that are available through Convert2Green – the catalogue will be used as promotional document for attracting OITB users and customers.

result.title: Common Policy Agenda and Recommendations for Policy Makers
result.description: A common policy agenda based on existing policy frameworks such as the EC European Circular Economy Action Plan, European Green Deal and the SDGs will be developed and adapted to represent the needs and demands of the makerspace i.e. digital hardware DIHs community.

result.title: MOOC platform
result.description: The Massive Open Online Course will aggregate all the educational resources generated during the project, as well as the Open Makerspace Toolkit, and the Training of Trainer Report. The Open Educational Resources generated and collected will be made available in English and French. The educational resources will be continuously updated training after

result.title: Machinery - Map
result.description: Online map of machinery based on Open Know-Where standard (min. 500 entries, 100 from the EU DIH networks) with forms (taken from TRL7 to TRL9) and promotional material.

result.title: Contracts - Model & Prototype
